summary.span: Represents a time interval.

span.span: Represents a time interval.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A物件表示做為正數或負數數天、 時、 分、 秒和小數秒的測量時間間隔 （持續時間的時間與經過時間）。A object represents a time interval (duration of time or elapsed time) that is measured as a positive or negative number of days, hours, minutes, seconds, and fractions of a second. 結構也可用來代表天，但僅限於的時間，如果在特定日期與時間無關。The structure can also be used to represent the time of day, but only if the time is unrelated to a particular date. 否則，或結構應該改用。Otherwise, the or structure should be used instead. (如需有關使用結構，以反映的當日時間，請參閱[選擇之間 DateTime、 DateTimeOffset、 TimeSpan 和 TimeZoneInfo](~/docs/standard/datetime/choosing-between-datetime.md)。)(For more information about using the structure to reflect the time of day, see [Choosing Between DateTime, DateTimeOffset, TimeSpan, and TimeZoneInfo](~/docs/standard/datetime/choosing-between-datetime.md).) > [!NOTE] > A值代表時間間隔，並可以表示為特定數目的天數、 時、 分、 秒和毫秒為單位。A value represents a time interval and can be expressed as a particular number of days, hours, minutes, seconds, and milliseconds. 它表示一般的時間間隔，而不參考特定的開始或結束點，因為它無法依據年和月，這兩者都有數目可變的天數表示。Because it represents a general interval without reference to a particular start or end point, it cannot be expressed in terms of years and months, both of which have a variable number of days. 不同於值，表示的日期和時間，而不參考特定的時區，或值，表示特定時點的時間。It differs from a value, which represents a date and time without reference to a particular time zone, or a value, which represents a specific moment of time. 最大單位時間結構用來測量持續時間為一天。The largest unit of time that the structure uses to measure duration is a day. 時間間隔測量單位是天的一致性，因為較大的時間，例如月和年，單位中的天數數目而異。Time intervals are measured in days for consistency, because the number of days in larger units of time, such as months and years, varies. 值物件是等於表示的時間間隔的刻度數。The value of a object is the number of ticks that equal the represented time interval. 一個刻度等於 100 奈秒或一個 10-百萬分之一秒。A tick is equal to 100 nanoseconds, or one ten-millionth of a second. 值物件的範圍可以從至。The value of a object can range from to . ## TimeSpan 值具現化Instantiating a TimeSpan Value 您可以具現化數種方式中的值：You can instantiate a value in a number of ways: - 藉由呼叫其隱含的預設建構函式。By calling its implicit default constructor. 這會建立的物件，其值為，如下列範例所示。This creates an object whose value is , as the following example shows. [!code-csharp[System.TimeSpan.Class#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class/cs/instantiate1.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.Class#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class/vb/instantiate1.vb#2)] - 透過呼叫其中一個其明確的建構函式。By calling one of its explicit constructors. 下列範例會初始化指定的小時、 分鐘和秒數的值。The following example initializes a value to a specified number of hours, minutes, and seconds. [!code-csharp[System.TimeSpan.Class#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class/cs/instantiate1.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.Class#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class/vb/instantiate1.vb#3)] - 藉由呼叫方法或執行的作業會傳回值。By calling a method or performing an operation that returns a value. 例如，您可以具現化值，表示兩個日期和時間值，如下列範例所示的間隔。For example, you can instantiate a value that represents the interval between two date and time values, as the following example shows. [!code-csharp[System.TimeSpan.Class#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class/cs/instantiate1.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.Class#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class/vb/instantiate1.vb#4)] 您也可以初始化如此一來，如下列範例所示的零時間值的物件。You can also initialize a object to a zero time value in this way, as the following example shows. [!code-csharp[System.TimeSpan.Class#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class/cs/zero1.cs#6)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.Class#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class/vb/zero1.vb#6)] 式算術的運算子和方法的傳回值的， ，和結構。 values are returned by arithmetic operators and methods of the , , and structures. - 藉由剖析的字串表示值。By parsing the string representation of a value. 您可以使用和方法，將包含時間間隔的字串轉換值。You can use the and methods to convert strings that contain time intervals to values. 下列範例會使用方法，將轉換的字串陣列值。The following example uses the method to convert an array of strings to values. [!code-csharp[System.TimeSpan.Class#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class/cs/instantiate1.cs#5)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.Class#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class/vb/instantiate1.vb#5)] 此外，您可以定義要進行剖析與轉換的輸入字串的精確格式藉由呼叫值或方法。In addition, you can define the precise format of the input string to be parsed and converted to a value by calling the or method. ## TimeSpan 值上執行的作業Performing Operations on TimeSpan Values 您可以加入和減去持續期間透過和運算子，或藉由呼叫和方法。You can add and subtract time durations either by using the and operators, or by calling the and methods. 您也可以比較兩個持續期間藉由呼叫， ，和方法。You can also compare two time durations by calling the , , and methods. 結構也會包含和正數和負數的值轉換成時間間隔的方法The structure also includes the and methods, which convert time intervals to positive and negative values, 範圍值是至。The range of values is to . ## 格式化的 TimeSpan 值Formatting a TimeSpan Value A值可以表示成 [*-*]*d*。*hh*:*公釐*:*ss*。*ff*，選擇性的負號，表示負的時間間隔，其中*d*元件為天數， *hh*為 24 小時制，*公釐*是分鐘， *ss*為秒，和*ff*是分數的第二個。A value can be represented as [*-*]*d*.*hh*:*mm*:*ss*.*ff*, where the optional minus sign indicates a negative time interval, the *d* component is days, *hh* is hours as measured on a 24-hour clock, *mm* is minutes, *ss* is seconds, and *ff* is fractions of a second. 時間間隔也就是包含正數或負數數天內不含日的時間或數天的日期，一次或一天的時間。That is, a time interval consists of a positive or negative number of days without a time of day, or a number of days with a time of day, or only a time of day. 開頭為[!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)]、結構支援的文化特性格式，透過多載其方法，將轉換為其字串表示的值。Beginning with the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)], the structure supports culture-sensitive formatting through the overloads of its method, which converts a value to its string representation. 預設值方法傳回時間間隔，使用格式而異，等同於在舊版的.NET Framework 及其傳回值。The default method returns a time interval by using an invariant format that is identical to its return value in previous versions of the .NET Framework. 多載可讓您指定格式字串，定義的時間間隔的字串表示。The overload lets you specify a format string that defines the string representation of the time interval. 多載可讓您指定格式字串和其格式設定慣例用來建立時間間隔的字串表示的文化特性。The overload lets you specify a format string and the culture whose formatting conventions are used to create the string representation of the time interval. 支援兩個標準和自訂格式字串。 supports both standard and custom format strings. (如需詳細資訊，請參閱[標準 TimeSpan 格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md)和[自訂 TimeSpan 格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md)。)不過，僅標準格式字串會區分文化特性。(For more information, see [Standard TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md) and [Custom TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md).) However, only standard format strings are culture-sensitive. ## 還原舊版 TimeSpan 格式Restoring Legacy TimeSpan Formatting 在某些情況下，程式碼中，成功格式值[!INCLUDE[net_v35_short](~/includes/net-v35-short-md.md)]和舊版中失敗[!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)]。In some cases, code that successfully formats values in [!INCLUDE[net_v35_short](~/includes/net-v35-short-md.md)] and earlier versions fails in [!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)]. 這是呼叫的程式碼中最常見[< TimeSpan_LegacyFormatMode > 項目](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/runtime/timespan-legacyformatmode-element.md)方法來格式化格式字串的值。This is most common in code that calls a [ element](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/runtime/timespan-legacyformatmode-element.md) method to format a value with a format string. 下列範例已成功格式化中的值[!INCLUDE[net_v35_short](~/includes/net-v35-short-md.md)]和舊版中，但是擲回例外狀況[!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)]和更新版本。The following example successfully formats a value in [!INCLUDE[net_v35_short](~/includes/net-v35-short-md.md)] and earlier versions, but throws an exception in [!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)] and later versions. 請注意，它會嘗試格式化值使用不支援的格式規範，會忽略[!INCLUDE[net_v35_short](~/includes/net-v35-short-md.md)]及較早版本。Note that it attempts to format a value by using an unsupported format specifier, which is ignored in [!INCLUDE[net_v35_short](~/includes/net-v35-short-md.md)] and earlier versions. [!code-csharp[System.TimeSpan.Class.Legacy#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class.legacy/cs/legacycode1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.Class.Legacy#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class.legacy/vb/legacycode1.vb#1)] 如果您無法修改程式碼，您可以還原的舊版格式中透過下列方式的其中一個值：If you cannot modify the code, you can restore the legacy formatting of values in one of the following ways: - 藉由建立組態檔包含[< TimeSpan_LegacyFormatMode > 項目](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/runtime/timespan-legacyformatmode-element.md)。By creating a configuration file that contains the [ element](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/runtime/timespan-legacyformatmode-element.md). 設定這個項目`enabled`屬性`true`還原舊版格式化每個應用程式為基礎。Setting this element's `enabled` attribute to `true` restores legacy formatting on a per-application basis. - 藉由設定 「 NetFx40_TimeSpanLegacyFormatMode 「 相容性時，切換建立應用程式定義域。By setting the "NetFx40_TimeSpanLegacyFormatMode" compatibility switch when you create an application domain. 這可讓舊版格式針對每個應用程式網域。This enables legacy formatting on a per-application-domain basis. 下列範例會建立應用程式網域，是使用舊版格式。The following example creates an application domain that uses legacy formatting. [!code-csharp[System.TimeSpan.Class.AppDomain#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class.appdomain/cs/perappdomain1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.Class.AppDomain#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class.appdomain/vb/perappdomain1.vb#1)] 當新的應用程式定義域中，執行下列程式碼時，它會還原成舊版格式化行為。When the following code executes in the new application domain, it reverts to legacy formatting behavior. [!code-csharp[System.TimeSpan.Class.AppDomain#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class.appdomain/cs/showtimespan.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.Class.AppDomain#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class.appdomain/vb/showtimespan.vb#2)] ## Examples 下列範例會具現化物件，表示兩個日期之間的差異。The following example instantiates a object that represents the difference between two dates. 接著會顯示物件的屬性。It then displays the object's properties. [!code-csharp[System.TimeSpan.Class#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class/cs/structure1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.Class#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class/vb/structure1.vb#1)] [!code-powershell[System.TimeSpan.Class#1](~/samples/snippets/powershell/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class/ps/structure1.ps1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks A值可以表示成 [*-*]*d*。*hh*:*公釐*:*ss*。*ff*，選擇性的負號，表示負的時間間隔，其中*d*元件為天數， *hh*為 24 小時制，*公釐*是分鐘， *ss*為秒，和*ff*是分數的第二個。A value can be represented as [*-*]*d*.*hh*:*mm*:*ss*.*ff*, where the optional minus sign indicates a negative time interval, the *d* component is days, *hh* is hours as measured on a 24-hour clock, *mm* is minutes, *ss* is seconds, and *ff* is fractions of a second. 值屬性是日期元件， *d*。The value of the property is the day component, *d*. 屬性表示整個工作日，而屬性代表整數和小數的天數。The property represents whole days, whereas the property represents whole and fractional days. ## Examples 下列範例會建立數個物件並顯示每個屬性。The following example creates several objects and displays the property of each. remarks.format: ## Remarks `s`參數會包含在表單中的時間間隔規格：The `s` parameter contains a time interval specification in the form: [*ws*] [-] { *d* | [*d*。]*hh*:*公釐*[:*ss*[。*ff*]]} [*ws*][*ws*][-]{ *d* | [*d*.]*hh*:*mm*[:*ss*[.*ff*]] }[*ws*] 在方括號 ([ 和 ]) 中的項目是選擇性的項目。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 選取一個項目從清單的大括弧括住的替代項目 （{和}），中間以分隔號分隔 (|) 是必要。One selection from the list of alternatives enclosed in braces ({ and }) and separated by vertical bars (|) is required. 下表說明每個元素。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|選擇性的泛空白字元。Optional white space.| |-|選擇性的負號，表示負。An optional minus sign, which indicates a negative .| |*d**d*|天數，範圍從 0 到 10675199。Days, ranging from 0 to 10675199.| |。.|區分文化特性的符號分隔天個小時。A culture-sensitive symbol that separates days from hours. 非變異格式使用句號 ("。") 字元。The invariant format uses a period (".") character.| |*hh**hh*|時數，範圍從 0 到 23。Hours, ranging from 0 to 23.| |::|區分文化特性的時間分隔符號的符號。The culture-sensitive time separator symbol. 而異的格式會使用冒號 (":") 字元。The invariant format uses a colon (":") character.| |*mm**mm*|分鐘，範圍從 0 至 59 之間。Minutes, ranging from 0 to 59.| |*ss**ss*|選擇性的秒數，範圍從 0 至 59 之間。Optional seconds, ranging from 0 to 59.| |*.**.*|分開的第二個分數秒區分文化特性的符號。A culture-sensitive symbol that separates seconds from fractions of a second. 非變異格式使用句號 ("。") 字元。The invariant format uses a period (".") character.| |*ff**ff*|選擇性小數秒數，一個到七個十進位數字所組成。Optional fractional seconds, consisting of one to seven decimal digits.| 如果`s`引數不是日期值，它必須包含小時和分鐘數元件; 其他元件是選擇性的。If the `s` argument is not a day value only, it must include an hours and a minutes component; other components are optional. 如果它們存在時，每個時間元件的值必須落在指定範圍內。If they are present, the values of each time component must fall within a specified range. 例如，值*hh*的小時元件，必須是介於 0 到 23 之間。For example, the value of *hh*, the hours component, must be between 0 and 23. 因為此，傳遞"23: 00:00 」 至方法會傳回 23 小時的時間間隔。Because of this, passing "23:00:00" to the method returns a time interval of 23 hours. 相反地，傳遞"24: 00:00"傳回 24 天的時間間隔。On the other hand, passing "24:00:00" returns a time interval of 24 days. 因為 「 24 」 超出範圍的小時元件，則會將它解譯為的天數元件。Because "24" is outside the range of the hours component, it is interpreted as the days component. 元件的`s`必須共同指定時間間隔，大於或等於且小於或等於。The components of `s` must collectively specify a time interval that is greater than or equal to and less than or equal to . 方法會嘗試剖析`s`目前的文化特性使用的特定文化特性的格式。The method tries to parse `s` by using each of the culture-specific formats for the current culture. ## Examples 下列範例會使用方法，將轉換的字串陣列中每個項目值。The following example uses the method to convert each element in a string array to a value. 目前的系統文化特性變更為克羅埃西亞文-克羅埃西亞 (「 於 HR-HR") 和英文-美國 ("EN-US") 以說明目前的系統文化特性會在剖析作業的影響。It changes the current system culture to Croatian - Croatia ("hr-HR") and English - United States ("en-US") to illustrate how the current system culture affects the parsing operation. [!code-csharp[System.TimeSpan.Parse#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.parse/cs/parse1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.Parse#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.parse/vb/parse1.vb#1)]

When a time interval component in the string to be parsed contains more than seven digits, parsing operations in the [!INCLUDE[net_v35_short](~/includes/net-v35-short-md.md)] and earlier versions may behave differently from parsing operations in the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)]. In some cases, parsing operations that succeed in the [!INCLUDE[net_v35_short](~/includes/net-v35-short-md.md)] and earlier versions may fail and throw an in the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)]. In other cases, parsing operations that throw a in the [!INCLUDE[net_v35_short](~/includes/net-v35-short-md.md)] and earlier versions may fail and throw an in the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)]. The following example illustrates both scenarios. [*d*.]*hh*:*mm*[:*ss*[.*ff*]] }[*ws*] 方括號 （[和]） 是選擇性的; 中的項目選取一個項目從清單的大括弧括住的替代項目 （{和}），中間以分隔號分隔 (|) 是必要。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional; one selection from the list of alternatives |*ws**ws*|選擇性的泛空白字元。Optional white space.| |-|選擇性的負號，表示負。An optional minus sign, which indicates a negative .| |*d**d*|天數，範圍從 0 到 10675199。Days, ranging from 0 to 10675199.| |。.|區分文化特性的符號分隔天個小時。A culture-sensitive symbol that separates days from hours. 預設值是句點 ("。") 字元。The default value is a period (".") character.| |*hh**hh*|時數，範圍從 0 到 23。Hours, ranging from 0 to 23.| |::|區分文化特性的時間分隔符號的符號。The culture-sensitive time separator symbol.| |*mm**mm*|分鐘，範圍從 0 至 59 之間。Minutes, ranging from 0 to 59.| |*ss**ss*|選擇性的秒數，範圍從 0 至 59 之間。Optional seconds, ranging from 0 to 59.| |。.|分開的第二個分數秒區分文化特性的符號。A consisting of one to seven decimal digits.| 如果`input`引數不是日期值，它必須包含小時和分鐘數元件; 其他元件是選擇性的。If the `input` argument is not a day value only, it must include an hours and a minutes component; other components are optional. 如果它們存在時，每個時間元件的值必須落在指定範圍內。If they are present, the values of each time component must fall within a specified range. 例如，值*hh*的小時元件，必須是介於 0 到 23 之間。For example, the value of days component. 元件的`input`必須共同指定時間間隔，大於或等於且小於或等於。The components of `input` must collectively specify a time interval that is greater than or equal to and less than or equal to . 方法會嘗試剖析`input`所指定的文化特性使用的特定文化特性格式`formatProvider`。The method tries to parse `input` by using each of the culture-specific formats for the culture specified by `formatProvider`. `formatProvider`參數是實作，提供傳回之字串的格式相關的特定文化特性資訊。The `formatProvider` parameter is an implementation that provides culture-specific information about the format of the returned string. `formatProvider`參數可以是下列任一項：The `formatProvider` parameter can be any of the following: - A表示傳回的字串中反映其格式設定慣例的文化特性的物件。A object that represents the culture whose formatting conventions are to be reflected in the returned string. 所傳回物件屬性會定義傳回之字串的格式。The object returned by the property defines the formatting of the returned string. - A物件，定義傳回之字串的格式。A object that defines the formatting of the returned string. - 自訂物件實作介面。A custom object that implements the interface. 其方法會傳回提供格式設定資訊的物件。Its method returns a object that provides formatting information. 如果`formatProvider`是`null`、會使用目前文化特性相關聯的物件。If `formatProvider` is `null`, the object that is associated with the current culture is used. ## Examples 下列範例會定義陣列物件，並使用每個物件在呼叫方法來剖析字串陣列中的項目。The following example defines an array of objects, and uses each object in calls to the method to parse the elements in a string array. 此範例說明如何特定文化特性的慣例會影響格式化作業。The example illustrates how the conventions of a specific culture influence the formatting operation. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法剖析時間間隔，必須是所定義之格式的字串表示`format`參數，但該前置和尾端空白字元會被忽略。The method parses the string representation of a time interval, which must be in the format defined by the `format` parameter, except that leading and trailing white-space characters are ignored. 因為`input`的格式必須符合`format`牌，您應該一律使用例外狀況處理時將使用者所輸入字串轉換成時間間隔。Because `input` must conform to the format of `format` exactly, you should always use exception handling when converting a string input by the user to a time interval. 如果您不想使用例外狀況處理，您可以呼叫方法改為。If you prefer not to use exception handling, you can call the method instead. `format`參數是包含單一標準格式規範或一或多個自訂格式規範會定義所需的格式字串`input`。The `format` parameter is a string that contains either a single standard format specifier, or one or more custom format specifiers that define the required format of `input`. 如需有效的格式字串的詳細資訊，請參閱[標準 TimeSpan 格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md)和[自訂 TimeSpan 格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md)。For more information about valid format strings, see [Standard TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md) and [Custom TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md). > [!IMPORTANT] > 方法會使用指定的文化特性的慣例`formatProvider`參數只有當`format`是一種標準格式的字串，其值為"g"或"G"。The method uses the conventions of the culture specified by the `formatProvider` parameter only if `format` is a standard format string whose value is either "g" or "G". France ("fr-FR") culture. 字串可以代表一般短格式或一般長格式中的時間間隔。The strings can represent a time interval in either the general short format or the general long format. 此外，此範例會變更時間間隔的剖析方法將解譯單一數字的方式。In addition, the example changes the way in which the time interval parsing methods interpret a single digit. 一般情況下，單一數字會解譯為時間間隔的日數。Ordinarily, a single digit is interpreted as the number of days in a time interval. 相反地，`%h`自訂格式字串會用來將單一數字解譯成的時數。Instead, the `%h` custom format string is used to interpret a single digit as the number of hours. 這項變更生效，請注意，`%h`自訂格式字串必須優先於其他格式字串中的`formats`陣列。For this change to be effective, note that the `%h` custom format string must precede the other format strings in the `formats` array. A物件，定義傳回之字串的格式。A object that defines the formatting of the returned string. - 自訂物件實作介面。A custom object that implements the interface. 其方法會傳回提供格式設定資訊的物件。Its method returns a object that provides formatting information. 如果`formatProvider`是`null`、會使用目前文化特性相關聯的物件。If `formatProvider` is `null`, the object that is associated with the current culture is used. `styles`參數會影響剖析使用自訂格式字串的字串解譯。The `styles` parameter affects the interpretation of strings that are parsed using custom format strings. 它會判斷是否`input`只有在於負號會解譯為負的時間間隔 ()，或是否一律解譯為負的時間間隔 ()。It determines whether `input` is interpreted as a negative time interval only if a negative sign is present (), or whether it is always interpreted as a negative time interval (). 如果不使用`format`必須包含常值的負號 (例如"\\-") 已成功剖析負的時間間隔。If is not used, `format` must include a literal negative sign symbol (such as "\\-") to successfully parse a negative time interval. ## Examples 下列範例會呼叫方法，將轉換的字串陣列，以每個項目值。The following example calls the method to convert each element of a string array to a value. 字串可以代表一般短格式或一般長格式中的時間間隔。The strings can represent a time interval in either the general short format or the general long format. 此外，此範例會變更時間間隔的剖析方法將解譯單一數字的方式。In addition, the example changes the way in which the time interval parsing methods interpret a single digit. 一般情況下，單一數字會解譯為時間間隔的日數。Ordinarily, a single digit is interpreted as the number of days in a time interval. 相反地，`%h`自訂格式字串會用來將單一數字解譯成的時數。Instead, the `%h` custom format string is used to interpret a single digit as the number of hours. 這項變更生效，請注意，`%h`自訂格式字串必須優先於其他格式字串中的`formats`陣列。For this change to be effective, note that the `%h` custom format string must precede the other format strings in the `formats` array. 也請注意，輸出中，剖析字串使用此格式規範時，才使用方法呼叫中指定的旗標。Also note from the output that the flag specified in the method call is used only when parsing a string with this format specifier. remarks.format: ## Remarks 傳回的字串會以"c"格式規範格式化，並具有下列格式：The returned string is formatted with the "c" format specifier and has the following format: [-][*d*.]*hh*:*mm*:*ss*[.*fffffff*][-][*d*.]*hh*:*mm*:*ss*[.*fffffff*] 項目以方括號 （[和]） 可能不會包含在傳回的字串。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) may not be included in the returned string. 冒號和句號 (: and) 是常值字元。Colons and periods (: and.) are literal characters. 下表詳列 / literal 項目。The non-literal elements are listed in the following table. 請注意，所傳回的字串方法不會區分文化特性。Note that the string returned by the method is not culture-sensitive. |項目Item|描述Description| |----------|-----------------| |"-""-"|負號，表示負的時間間隔。A minus sign, which indicates a negative time interval. 沒有號就會包含正值的時間範圍。No sign is included for a positive time span.| |「*d*""*d*"|中的時間間隔的日數。The number of days in the time interval. 如果屬少於一天的時間間隔，則會忽略這個項目。This element is omitted if the time interval is less than one day.| |「*hh*""*hh*"|在時間間隔內，範圍從 0 到 23 的小時數。The number of hours in the time interval, ranging from 0 to 23.| |「*公釐*""*mm*"|在時間間隔內，範圍從 0 至 59 之間的分鐘數。The number of minutes in the time interval, ranging from 0 to 59.| |「*ss*""*ss*"|在時間間隔內，範圍從 0 到 59 的秒數。The number of seconds in the time interval, ranging from 0 to 59.| |「*fffffff*""*fffffff*"|中的時間間隔的小數秒。Fractional seconds in the time interval. 如果時間間隔不包括小數秒數，則會忽略這個項目。This element is omitted if the time interval does not include fractional seconds. 如果有的話，小數秒一律以使用七個十進位數字。If present, fractional seconds are always expressed using seven decimal digits.| > [!NOTE] > 如需有關比較的字串表示Oracle 資料類型，請參閱知識庫文件和[324577: System.TimeSpan 不比對 Oracle 9i INTERVAL DAY TO 第二個資料型別](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=161146)。For more information about comparing the string representation of and Oracle data types, see Knowledge Base article [324577: System.TimeSpan Does Not Match Oracle 9i INTERVAL DAY TO SECOND Data Type](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=161146). ## Examples 下列範例會顯示呼叫所傳回的字串方法具有數值。The following example displays the strings returned by calling the method with a number of values. 請注意，雖然此範例不會呼叫直接，它會呼叫方法方法時若嘗試轉換為其字串表示的值。Note that although the example does not call the method directly, it is called by the method when it attempts to convert a value to its string representation. [!code-csharp[System.TimeSpan.ToString#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.TimeSpan.ToString/cs/ToString1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.ToString#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.TimeSpan.ToString/vb/ToString1.vb#1)]

Support for formatting values was added in the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)]. However, the method overload remains culture-insensitive. Its behavior remains unchanged from previous versions of the .NET Framework. To control the formatting of a value, call the or overload.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `format`參數可以是任何有效的標準或自訂格式規範值。The `format` parameter can be any valid standard or custom format specifier for values. 如果`format`等於或`null`，目前的傳回值物件的格式設定以一般格式規範 ("c")。If `format` is equal to or is `null`, the return value of the current object is formatted with the common format specifier ("c"). 如果`format`是任何其他值，則方法會擲回。If `format` is any other value, the method throws a . 如果`format`是標準格式字串，傳回之字串的格式由目前的文化特性的格式化慣例所定義。If `format` is a standard format string, the format of the returned string is defined by the formatting conventions of the current culture. > [!IMPORTANT] > 自訂格式字串為值不包括日期或時間分隔符號。The custom format strings for values do not include a date or time separator. 如果您想要包含在格式字串中的這些項目，您必須將它們視為字元常值。If you want to include these elements in your format string, you must treat them as character literals. 請參閱範例如需圖例，並查看[自訂 TimeSpan 格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md)主題取得詳細資訊。See the example for an illustration, and see the [Custom TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md) topic for more information. .NET Framework 提供廣泛的格式化支援，下列格式的主題中的更詳細地說明：The .NET Framework provides extensive formatting support, which is described in greater detail in the following formatting topics: - 如需有關的格式字串值，請參閱[標準 TimeSpan 格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md)和[自訂 TimeSpan 格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md)。For more information about format strings for values, see [Standard TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md) and [Custom TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md). - 如需.NET Framework 中的格式化支援的詳細資訊，請參閱[格式化型別](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md)。For more information about support for formatting in the .NET Framework, see [Formatting Types](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md). ## Examples 下列範例會使用標準和自訂格式字串的陣列中顯示的字串表示，每個項目的值The following example uses standard and custom format strings to display the string representation of each element in an array of values [!code-csharp[System.TimeSpan.ToString#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.TimeSpan.ToString/cs/tostring3.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.ToString#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.TimeSpan.ToString/vb/tostring3.vb#3)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks `format`參數可以是任何有效的標準或自訂格式規範值。The `format` parameter can be any valid standard or custom format specifier for values. 如果`format`等於或`null`，目前的傳回值物件的格式設定以一般格式規範 ("c")。If `format` is equal to or is `null`, the return value of the current object is formatted with the common format specifier ("c"). 如果格式為任何其他值，這個方法會擲回。If format is any other value, the method throws a . > [!IMPORTANT] > 自訂格式字串為值不包括日期或時間分隔符號。The custom format strings for values do not include a date or time separator. 如果您想要包含在格式字串中的這些項目，您必須將它們視為字元常值。If you want to include these elements in your format string, you must treat them as character literals. 請參閱範例如需圖例，並查看[自訂 TimeSpan 格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md)主題取得詳細資訊。See the example for an illustration, and see the [Custom TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md) topic for more information. .NET Framework 提供廣泛的格式化支援，下列格式的主題中的更詳細地說明：The .NET Framework provides extensive formatting support, which is described in greater detail in the following formatting topics: - 如需有關的格式字串值，請參閱[標準 TimeSpan 格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md)和[自訂 TimeSpan 格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md)。For more information about format strings for values, see [Standard TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md) and [Custom TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md). - 如需.NET Framework 中的格式化支援的詳細資訊，請參閱[格式化型別](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md)。For more information about support for formatting in the .NET Framework, see [Formatting Types](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md). `formatProvider`參數是實作，提供傳回之字串的格式相關的特定文化特性資訊。The `formatProvider` parameter is an implementation that provides culture-specific information about the format of the returned string. `formatProvider`參數可以是下列任一項：The `formatProvider` parameter can be any of the following: - A表示傳回的字串中反映其格式設定慣例的文化特性的物件。A object that represents the culture whose formatting conventions are to be reflected in the returned string. 所傳回的物件屬性會定義傳回之字串的格式。The object retuned by the property defines the formatting of the returned string. - A物件，定義傳回之字串的格式。A object that defines the formatting of the returned string. - 自訂物件實作介面。A custom object that implements the interface. 其方法會傳回提供格式設定資訊的物件。Its method returns a object that provides formatting information. 如果`formatProvider`是`null`、會使用目前文化特性相關聯的物件。If `formatProvider` is `null`, the object that is associated with the current culture is used. 如果`format`是自訂格式字串，`formatProvider`參數已忽略。If `format` is a custom format string, the `formatProvider` parameter is ignored. ## Examples 下列範例會呼叫方法來格式化兩個時間間隔。The following example calls the method to format two time intervals. 此範例會呼叫每一個格式字串，第一次才能使用 EN-US 文化特性的慣例顯示兩次的方法，然後顯示使用 FR-FR 文化特性的慣例。The example calls the method twice for each format string, first to display it using the conventions of the en-US culture and then to display it using the conventions of the fr-FR culture. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法就像方法，但是它不會擲回例外狀況如果轉換失敗。The method is like the method, except that it does not throw an exception if the conversion fails. `s`參數會包含在表單中的時間間隔規格：The `s` parameter contains a time interval specification in the form: [*ws*] [-] { *d* | *d*。*hh*:*公釐*[:*ss*[。*ff*]] | *hh*:*公釐*[:*ss*[。*ff*]]} [*ws*][*ws*][-]{ *d* | *d*.*hh*:*mm*[:*ss*[.*ff*]] | *hh*:*mm*[:*ss*[.*ff*]] }[*ws*] 在方括號 ([ 和 ]) 中的項目是選擇性的項目。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 選取一個項目從清單的大括弧括住的替代項目 （{和}），中間以分隔號分隔 (|) 是必要。One selection from the list of alternatives enclosed in braces ({ and }) and separated by vertical bars (|) is required. 下表說明每個元素。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|選擇性的泛空白字元。Optional white space.| |-|選擇性的負號，表示負。An optional minus sign, which indicates a negative .| |*d**d*|天數，範圍從 0 到 10675199。Days, ranging from 0 to 10675199.| |。.|區分文化特性的符號分隔天個小時。A culture-sensitive symbol that separates days from hours. 非變異格式使用句號 ("。") 字元。The invariant format uses a period (".") character.| |*hh**hh*|時數，範圍從 0 到 23。Hours, ranging from 0 to 23.| |::|區分文化特性的時間分隔符號的符號。The culture-sensitive time separator symbol. 而異的格式會使用冒號 (":") 字元。The invariant format uses a colon (":") character.| |*mm**mm*|分鐘，範圍從 0 至 59 之間。Minutes, ranging from 0 to 59.| |*ss**ss*|選擇性的秒數，範圍從 0 至 59 之間。Optional seconds, ranging from 0 to 59.| |。.|分開的第二個分數秒區分文化特性的符號。A culture-sensitive symbol that separates seconds from fractions of a second. 非變異格式使用句號 ("。") 字元。The invariant format uses a period (".") character.| |*ff**ff*|選擇性小數秒數，一個到七個十進位數字所組成。Optional fractional seconds, consisting of one to seven decimal digits.| 元件的`s`必須共同指定時間間隔，大於或等於且小於或等於。The components of `s` must collectively specify a time interval that is greater than or equal to and less than or equal to . 方法會嘗試剖析`s`目前的文化特性使用的特定文化特性的格式。The method tries to parse `s` by using each of the culture-specific formats for the current culture. ## Examples 下列範例會使用方法來建立物件從有效字串，並表示時，剖析作業失敗，因為時間範圍字串無效。The following example uses the method to create objects from valid strings and to indicate when the parse operation has failed because the time span string is invalid. [!code-csharp[System.TimeSpan.TryParse#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.TimeSpan.TryParse/cs/TryParse1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.TryParse#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.TimeSpan.TryParse/vb/TryParse1.vb#1)]

span.para: 在某些情況下，當時間間隔中的元件要剖析的字串包含七個以上的數字，剖析作業成功，[！INCLUDE[net_v35_short](~/includes/net-v35-short-md.md)] 和較早版本可能會失敗並擲回中 [！INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)]，下列範例說明這種情況。 [！ 的程式碼 csharp [System.TimeSpan.TryParse#3] (~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/系統。TimeSpan.TryParse/cs/tryparsefailure1.cs#3)] [！ 的程式碼 vb [System.TimeSpan.TryParse#3] (~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/系統。TimeSpan.TryParse/vb/tryparsefailure1.vb#3)]

In some cases, when a time interval component in the string to be parsed contains more than seven digits, parsing operations that succeed in the [!INCLUDE[net_v35_short](~/includes/net-v35-short-md.md)] and earlier versions may fail and throw an in the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)], The following example illustrates this scenario. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法剖析時間間隔，必須是所定義之格式的字串表示`format`參數，但該前置和尾端空白字元會被忽略。The method parses the string representation of a time interval, which must be in the format defined by the `format` parameter, except that leading and trailing white-space characters are ignored. 這個方法是類似於方法，但是它不會擲回例外狀況如果轉換失敗。This method is similar to the method, except that it does not throw an exception if the conversion fails. `format`參數是包含單一標準格式規範或一或多個自訂格式規範會定義所需的格式字串`input`。The `format` parameter is a string that contains either a single standard format specifier, or one or more custom format specifiers that define the required format of `input`. 如需有效的格式字串的詳細資訊，請參閱[標準 TimeSpan 格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md)和[自訂 TimeSpan 格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md)。For more information about valid format strings, see [Standard TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md) and [Custom TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md). > [!IMPORTANT] > 方法會使用指定的文化特性的慣例`formatProvider`參數只有當`format`是一種標準格式的字串，其值為"g"或"G"。The method uses the conventions of the culture specified by the `formatProvider` parameter only if `format` is a standard format string whose value is either "g" or "G". "C"、"t"和"T"標準格式字串使用的格式設定慣例的文化特性而異。The "c", "t", and "T" standard format strings use the formatting conventions of the invariant culture. 自訂格式字串定義精確輸入字串的格式，並使用常值字元分隔的時間間隔的元件。Custom format strings define the precise format of the input string and use literal characters to separate the components of a time interval. `formatProvider`參數是實作，提供傳回之字串的格式相關的特定文化特性資訊，如果`format`是標準格式字串。The `formatProvider` parameter is an implementation that provides culture-specific information about the format of the returned string if `format` is a standard format string. `formatProvider`參數可以是下列任一項：The `formatProvider` parameter can be any of the following: - A表示傳回的字串中反映其格式設定慣例的文化特性的物件。A object that represents the culture whose formatting conventions are to be reflected in the returned string. 所傳回物件屬性會定義傳回之字串的格式。The object returned by the property defines the formatting of the returned string. - A物件，定義傳回之字串的格式。A object that defines the formatting of the returned string. - 自訂物件實作介面。A custom object that implements the interface. 其方法會傳回提供格式設定資訊的物件。Its method returns a object that provides formatting information. 如果`formatProvider`是`null`、會使用目前文化特性相關聯的物件。If `formatProvider` is `null`, the object that is associated with the current culture is used. ## Examples 下列範例會使用方法來剖析數個使用不同的格式字串和文化特性的時間間隔的字串表示。The following example uses the method to parse several string representations of time intervals using various format strings and cultures. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法剖析字串表示的時間間隔，其中一個所指定的格式字串所定義的格式必須是`formats`參數，但該前置和尾端空白字元會被忽略。The method parses the string representation of a time interval, which must be in the format defined by one of the format strings specified by the `formats` parameter, except that leading and trailing white-space characters are ignored. 這個方法是類似於方法，但是它不會擲回例外狀況如果轉換失敗。This method is similar to the method, except that it does not throw an exception if the conversion fails. `formats`參數是字串陣列，其項目組成單一標準格式規範或一或多個自訂格式規範會定義所需的格式`input`。The `formats` parameter is a string array whose elements consist of either a single standard format specifier, or one or more custom format specifiers that define the required format of `input`. 如需有效的格式字串的詳細資訊，請參閱[標準 TimeSpan 格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md)和[自訂 TimeSpan 格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md)。For more information about valid format strings, see [Standard TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md) and [Custom TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md). `input` 必須對應到的成員完全`formats`的剖析作業成功。`input` must correspond exactly to a member of `formats` for the parse operation to succeed. 剖析作業會嘗試比對`input`中每個項目`formats`陣列中的第一個元素開始。The parse operation attempts to match `input` to each element in `formats` starting with the first element in the array. > [!IMPORTANT] > 方法會使用指定的文化特性的慣例`formatProvider`參數用來剖析的格式字串時，才`input`是一種標準格式的字串，其值為"g"或"G"。The method uses the conventions of the culture specified by the `formatProvider` parameter only if the format string used to parse `input` is a standard format string whose value is either "g" or "G". "C"、"t"和"T"標準格式字串使用的格式設定慣例的文化特性而異。The "c", "t", and "T" standard format strings use the formatting conventions of the invariant culture. 自訂格式字串定義精確輸入字串的格式，並使用常值字元分隔的時間間隔的元件。Custom format strings define the precise format of the input string and use literal characters to separate the components of a time interval. `formatProvider`參數是實作，提供傳回之字串的格式相關的特定文化特性資訊，如果格式字串用來剖析`input`是標準格式字串。The `formatProvider` parameter is an implementation that provides culture-specific information about the format of the returned string if the format string used to parse `input` is a standard format string. `formatProvider`參數可以是下列任一項：The `formatProvider` parameter can be any of the following: - A表示傳回的字串中反映其格式設定慣例的文化特性的物件。A object that represents the culture whose formatting conventions are to be reflected in the returned string. 所傳回物件屬性會定義傳回之字串的格式。The object returned by the property defines the formatting of the returned string. - A物件，定義傳回之字串的格式。A object that defines the formatting of the returned string. - 自訂物件實作介面。A custom object that implements the interface. 其方法會傳回提供格式設定資訊的物件。Its method returns a object that provides formatting information. 如果`formatProvider`是`null`、會使用目前文化特性相關聯的物件。If `formatProvider` is `null`, the object that is associated with the current culture is used. ## Examples 下列範例會呼叫方法，將轉換的字串陣列，以每個項目值。The following example calls the method to convert each element of a string array to a value. 此範例會使用法文-法國 (「 FR-FR 」) 文化特性的格式化慣例來解譯字串。The example interprets the strings by using the formatting conventions of the French - France ("fr-FR") culture. 字串可以代表一般短格式或一般長格式中的時間間隔。The strings can represent a time interval in either the general short format or the general long format. 此外，此範例會變更時間間隔的剖析方法將解譯單一數字的方式。In addition, the example changes the way in which the time interval parsing methods interpret a single digit. 一般情況下，單一數字會解譯為時間間隔的日數。Ordinarily, a single digit is interpreted as the number of days in a time interval. 相反地，`%h`自訂格式字串會用來將單一數字解譯成的時數。Instead, the `%h` custom format string is used to interpret a single digit as the number of hours. 這項變更生效，請注意，`%h`自訂格式字串必須優先於其他格式字串中的`formats`陣列。For this change to be effective, note that the `%h` custom format string must precede the other format strings in the `formats` array. A表示傳回的字串中反映其格式設定慣例的文化特性的物件。A object that represents the culture whose formatting conventions are to be reflected in the returned string. 所傳回物件屬性會定義傳回之字串的格式。The object returned by the property defines the formatting of the returned string. - A物件，定義傳回之字串的格式。A object that defines the formatting of the returned string. - 自訂物件實作介面。A custom object that implements the interface. 其方法會傳回提供格式設定資訊的物件。Its method returns a object that provides formatting information. 如果`formatProvider`是`null`、會使用目前文化特性相關聯的物件。If `formatProvider` is `null`, the object that is associated with the current culture is used. `styles`參數會影響剖析使用自訂格式字串的字串解譯。The `styles` parameter affects the interpretation of strings parsed using custom format strings. 它會判斷是否`input`只有在於負號會解譯為負的時間間隔 ()，或是否一律解譯為負的時間間隔 ()。It determines whether `input` is interpreted as a negative time interval only if a negative sign is present (), or whether it is always interpreted as a negative time interval (). 如果不使用`format`必須包含常值的負號 (例如"\\-") 已成功剖析負的時間間隔。If is not used, `format` must include a literal negative sign symbol (such as "\\-") to successfully parse a negative time interval. ## Examples 下列範例會使用方法來剖析數個使用不同的格式字串和文化特性的時間間隔的字串表示。The following example uses the method to parse several string representations of time intervals using various format strings and cultures. 它也會使用將每個字串解譯為負的時間間隔的值。It also uses the value to interpret each string as a negative time interval. 範例輸出說明了樣式會影響傳回值，只有在使用自訂格式字串時。The output from the example illustrates that the style affects the return value only when it is used with custom format strings. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法剖析字串表示的時間間隔，其中一個所指定的格式字串所定義的格式必須是`formats`參數，但該前置和尾端空白字元會被忽略。The method parses the string representation of a time interval, which must be in the format defined by one of the format strings specified by the `formats` parameter, except that leading and trailing white-space characters are ignored. 這個方法是類似於方法，但是它不會擲回例外狀況如果轉換失敗。This method is similar to the method, except that it does not throw an exception if the conversion fails. `formats`參數是字串陣列，其項目組成單一標準格式規範或一或多個自訂格式規範會定義所需的格式`input`。The `formats` parameter is a string array whose elements consist of either a single standard format specifier, or one or more custom format specifiers that define the required format of `input`. 如需有效的格式字串的詳細資訊，請參閱[標準 TimeSpan 格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md)和[自訂 TimeSpan 格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md)。For more information about valid format strings, see [Standard TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md) and [Custom TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md). `input` 必須對應到的成員完全`formats`的剖析作業成功。`input` must correspond exactly to a member of `formats` for the parse operation to succeed. 剖析作業會嘗試比對`input`中每個項目`formats`陣列中的第一個元素開始。The parse operation attempts to match `input` to each element in `formats` starting with the first element in the array. > [!IMPORTANT] > 方法會使用指定的文化特性的慣例`formatProvider`參數用來剖析的格式字串時，才`input`是一種標準格式的字串，其值為"g"或"G"。The method uses the conventions of the culture specified by the `formatProvider` parameter only if the format string used to parse `input` is a standard format string whose value is either "g" or "G". "C"、"t"和"T"標準格式字串使用的格式設定慣例的文化特性而異。The "c", "t", and "T" standard format strings use the formatting conventions of the invariant culture. 自訂格式字串定義精確輸入字串的格式，並使用常值字元分隔的時間間隔的元件。Custom format strings define the precise format of the input string and use literal characters to separate the components of a time interval. `formatProvider`參數是實作，提供傳回之字串的格式相關的特定文化特性資訊，如果格式字串用來剖析`input`是標準格式字串。The `formatProvider` parameter is an implementation that provides culture-specific information about the format of the returned string if the format string used to parse `input` is a standard format string. `formatProvider`參數可以是下列任一項：The `formatProvider` parameter can be any of the following: - A表示傳回的字串中反映其格式設定慣例的文化特性的物件。A object that represents the culture whose formatting conventions are to be reflected in the returned string. 所傳回物件屬性會定義傳回之字串的格式。The object returned by the property defines the formatting of the returned string. - A物件，定義傳回之字串的格式。A object that defines the formatting of the returned string. - 自訂物件實作介面。A custom object that implements the interface. 其方法會傳回提供格式設定資訊的物件。Its method returns a object that provides formatting information. 如果`formatProvider`是`null`、會使用目前文化特性相關聯的物件。If `formatProvider` is `null`, the object that is associated with the current culture is used. `styles`參數會影響剖析使用自訂格式字串的字串解譯。The `styles` parameter affects the interpretation of strings that are parsed using custom format strings. 它會判斷是否`input`只有在於負號會解譯為負的時間間隔 ()，或是否一律解譯為負的時間間隔 ()。It determines whether `input` is interpreted as a negative time interval only if a negative sign is present (), or whether it is always interpreted as a negative time interval (). 如果不使用`format`必須包含常值的負號 (例如"\\-") 已成功剖析負的時間間隔。If is not used, `format` must include a literal negative sign symbol (such as "\\-") to successfully parse a negative time interval. ## Examples 下列範例會呼叫方法，將轉換的字串陣列，以每個項目值。The following example calls the method to convert each element of a string array to a value. 字串可以代表一般短格式或一般長格式中的時間間隔。The strings can represent a time interval in either the general short format or the general long format. 此外，此範例會變更時間間隔的剖析方法將解譯單一數字的方式。In addition, the example changes the way in which the time interval parsing methods interpret a single digit. 一般情況下，單一數字會解譯為時間間隔的日數。Ordinarily, a single digit is interpreted as the number of days in a time interval. 相反地，`%h`自訂格式字串會用來將單一數字解譯成的時數。Instead, the `%h` custom format string is used to interpret a single digit as the number of hours. 這項變更生效，請注意，`%h`自訂格式字串必須優先於其他格式字串中的`formats`陣列。For this change to be effective, note that the `%h` custom format string must precede the other format strings in the `formats` array. 也請注意，輸出中，剖析字串使用此格式規範時，才使用方法呼叫中指定的旗標。Also note from the output that the flag specified in the method call is used only when parsing a string with this format specifier. remarks.format: ## Remarks 因為值欄位是物件，代表零時間值，您可以比較它與其他物件來判斷是否後者代表正數、 非零或負數時間間隔。Because the value of the field is a object that represents a zero time value, you can compare it with other objects to determine whether the latter represent positive, non-zero, or negative time intervals. 您也可以使用此欄位來初始化為零的時間值的物件。You can also use this field to initialize a object to a zero time value. ## Examples 下列範例會參考並顯示的值欄位。The following example references and displays the value of the field.
